articles.title: Kim Jong Un Replies to Foreign Party and State Leaders
articles.content:
Portavoz de UPC apoya justa lucha de hombres de prensa de Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 5 de febrero (ACNC) -- Hace poco, el sindicato de radiodifusion MBC del Sur de Corea comenzo la huelga general indefinida en protesta al intento de  apoderarla de la banda de Lee Myung Bak.
					El portavoz del Comite Central de la Union de Periodistas de Corea en su declaracion del dia 4 senala que la huelga es la explosion de la colera y protesta de los hombres de prensa y los habitantes surcoreanos a la banda traidora que utiliza la prensa al servilismo a grandes potencias, la dominacion fascista y las maniobras anti-reunificacion y fratricidas. 
					
					Al tomar el poder, la banda de Lee Myung Bak empeoro las leyes relacionadas con la prensa, infiltro a los elementos conservadores y ultraderechistas en el circulo mediatico con el objetivo de exterminar la opinion publica aspirante a la independencia, la democracia y la reunificacion y reprimio despiadadamente a los hombres de prensa en contra de la prensa progubernamental, revela la nota y prosigue: 
					
					Ahora, la banda traidora que esta a punto de derrumbarse perdiendo totalmente el respaldo de los habitantes, se desespera para evadir el severo juicio y realizar la ambicion de retomar el poder en las elecciones de este ano inventando a su favor la opinion publica y desinformaciones adhiriendose a todos medios venales de prensa.
					
					Es natural que los hombres conscientes de prensa del Sur de Corea se levanten en la lucha contra las maquinaciones de la banda traidora encaminada a la realizacion venal de los medios de prensa y su conversion en reaccionarios lamentandose de la tragica realidad de los medios de prensa convertidos en viles servidores de la banda de los conservadores titeres.
					
					Los medios de prensa de la epoca de la reunificacion independiente deben castigar severamente a la banda traidora que actua freneticamente con el servilismo a EE.UU. y la confrontacion fratricida y ser trompeteros que impulsan activamente la gran marcha por la reunificacion independiente de los connacionales que avanzan bajo la bandera del ideal "Entre nosotros, los connacionales".
					
					Todos los periodistas y hombres de la palabra de la RPDC estan convencidos de que saldra victoriosa brillante la justa lucha de los hombres mediaticos surcoreanos por traer el nuevo mundo independizado y democratizado y seguir la corriente de la epoca del 15 de Junio por la reunificacion.

articles.title: S. Korean Media Persons' Struggle for Justice Backed
articles.content:
S. Korean Media Persons' Struggle for Justice Backed
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The trade union of MBC of south Korea went on a general strike for an indefinite period in protest against the Lee Myung Bak group's seizure of the broadcasting service.
					 A spokesman for the Central Committee of the Journalists Union of Korea in a statement on Saturday said their strike is an eruption of anger and resistance of the south Korean media persons and all other people against the group of traitors abusing media for sycophancy and treachery, fascist rule, actions against reunification and confrontation with compatriots.
					
					The statement accused the Lee group of making a retrogressive revision of laws on media to quell the public mind-set and opinion desirous of independence, democracy and reunification and planting ultra right vicious conservative elements among media and indiscriminately purging those media persons opposed to the moves to put media under government control after it came to power. 
					
					 Having driven into an abyss of ruin, completely forsaken by the public, the group is setting all reptile media in motion in a last-ditch effort to escape a stern judgment in the upcoming elections through an unlimited false propaganda and spread of misinformation and thus stay in power come what may, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 It is quite natural that the fair-minded media persons of south Korea courageously turned out in the actions against the traitors' group to make the media serve it and reactionary, deploring the miserable reality of media reduced to a despicable servant for the puppet conservative group. 
					
					 The media in the era of independent reunification should be a judge meting out punishment to the group of traitors keen on sycophancy towards the U.S. and confrontation against fellow countrymen and a bugler dynamically encouraging all Koreans in their general advance for independent reunification under the banner of "By our nation itself".
					
					 All the media persons in the DPRK are firmly convinced that the south Korean media persons will surely emerge victorious in their actions for bringing earlier an independent and democratic society and giving steady continuity to the trend of the June 15 era of reunification.

articles.title: New Year Greetings from Various Countries
articles.content:
New Year Greetings from Various Countries
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Workers' Party of Korea and people of the DPRK, received messages and letters of greetings from different countries on the occasion of the New Year.
					 They were from the chairman of the C.C., Nepal Worker-Peasant Party, the general secretary of the C.C., Communist Party of Lebanon, the secretary general of the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia, the secretary general of the Union Solidarity and Development Party, Union of Myanmar, the chairman of the C.C., Workers' Party of Bangladesh, the chairman of the Central Executive Committee of the Bangladesh National Socialist Party, the general secretary of the C.C., Socialist Party of Bangladesh, the president of the Bangladesh People's League, the president of the Khmer Democratic Party of Cambodia, the executive chairman of the PUNCINPEC Party of Cambodia, the general secretary of the Palestinian Popular Struggle Front, the general secretary of the All-India Forward Bloc, the chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania, the chairman of the C.C., Communist Party of the Russian Federation, the chairman of the National Salvation Front of Russia, the chairman of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia, the chairwoman of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia, the chairman of the Hungarian Communist Workers' Party, the honorary chairman of the Bulgarian Communists Union, the first secretary and the secretary of the C.C., Communist Workers' Party of Belarus, the chairman of the Finnish Communists' League, the spokesman (leader) of the C.C., Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist), the general secretary of the Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy, the president of the Socialist Party of Benin, the national permanent secretary of the Democratic Party of Senegal, the general secretary of the Communist Party of Democratic Congo, the chairman of the C.C., Socialist Party of Mexico, the chairman of the C.C., Socialist Popular Party of Mexico, the general secretary of the C.C., People's Socialist Party of Mexico, the president of the Workers' Party of Peru and the chairman and the general secretary of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru.
					
					 They also came from the Syrian defense minister who is deputy commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces, the chairman for National Defense, Security and International Relations of the Central Directive Council of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle, the international secretary of the Communist Party of Sweden, a secretary of the C.C., Slovak Communist Party, the director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea who is secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council, the director-general of the International Kim Il Sung Foundation, the former defense minister of the Soviet Union, the head and the manager of the State Academy Beryozka Dancing Troupe of Russia Named after N.S. Nadezhdina, the director of the State Academic Igor Moiseyev Dance Company of Russia, the head of the Russian State Academic People's Chorus Named after M.E.Pyatnichki, the chief of the Academy Ensemble of the Interior Unit of the Russian Ministry of Interior, the head of the "Orchestra of the 21st Century" of Russia, the chairman of the Italian General Investment Group who is chairman of the Development Bank of the Mediterranean, the director-general of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, the executive director of the World Food Programme, the secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, the vice director-general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the secretary general of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea and the governor of Amur Region, the mayor of Khabarovsk City and the administrative governor of Maritime Territory of Russia, and other high-ranking officials of political, social and economic circles of China, Russia, Nepal, Lebanon, Malaysia, Myanmar, Mongolia, Bangladesh, Syria, Cambodia, Pakistan, Iran, India, Norway, Denmark, Bulgaria, Belarus, the Czech Republic, France, Finland, UK, Austria, Ukraine, Iceland, Italy, Spain, Guinea, Nigeria, South Africa, Benin, Democratic Congo, Mexico, the United States, Brazil, Colombia, Peru and New Zealand and representatives of international bodies, Juche idea study organizations, and organizations for supporting Korea's reunification and friendship with the DPRK. 
					
					 In the messages and letters they noted that the Korean people turned their sorrow into thousand-fold courage and strength to rise up as they have Kim Jong Un, heir to the revolutionary cause of Juche, as supreme leader of the party, state and army. 
					
					 They expressed belief that the Korean people would achieve bigger successes in the grand drive for this year under the leadership of Kim Jong Un true to the behests of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee received a congratulatory message from the general secretary of the National Council of the Communist Party of India on the same occasion.

articles.title: Oath-taking Meeting of School Youth and Children
articles.content:
Oath-taking Meeting of School Youth and Children
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- School youth and children from across the country held an oath-taking meeting in front of leader Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the secret camp of Mt. Paektu on Sunday. They were participating in the study tour of the birthplace on the occasion of his 70th birth anniversary (the Day of the Shining Star). 
					 The participants laid floral baskets and flowers and made bows to the mosaic depicting images of President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk erected in the secret camp. 
					
					 Led by the secretary of the C.C., Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, they made a pledge to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche started in Mt. Paektu, true to the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They stressed that they would keep the immortal revolutionary exploits and behests of Kim Jong Il as their lifeline and reliably defend the legacy left by him. 
					
					 They chanted slogans reflecting their will to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem forever and glorify a new century of Kim Il Sung's Korea as annals of prosperity and shining victory under the leadership of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 At the end of the meeting they looked round relics preserved in the birthplace.

articles.title: Trade Union Officials Start Study-tour in Mt. Paektu Area
articles.content:
Trade Union Officials Start Study-tour in Mt. Paektu Area
 Hyesan, February 5 (KCNA) -- Officials and members of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK) from across the country started their study-tour of the revolutionary battle sites in Mt. Paektu area on the occasion of the 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star). 
					 A meeting for starting the tour took place in front of the Victorious Battle of Pochonbo Memorial Tower in Hyesan, Ryanggang Province, on Sunday.
					
					 The participants laid floral baskets and bouquets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung at the tower and paid tribute to him.
					
					 At the meeting Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the C.C., GFTUK, made a report which was followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers noted that Kim Jong Il, born as son of guerrillas in Mt.Paektu, performed immortal exploits for the country and the revolution, the era and history. 
					
					 They renewed their will to work fresh miracles and feats at their worksites under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 After the meeting, the group went round the tower.

articles.title: Poster for 16th Kimjongilia Festival Produced
articles.content:
Poster for 16th Kimjongilia Festival Produced
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- A poster has been produced in the DPRK for the 16th Kimjongilia Festival which is to be significantly held on the 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star). 
					 Depicted in the poster are Jong Il Peak and Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan secret camp. Printed there are slogan "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il is always with us" and flowers of the sun. 
					
					 Displayed on its upper part are letters reading "The Day of the Shining Star", the emblem of the festival and on its lower part are letters "The 16th Kimjongilia Festival" and its venue and period.

articles.title: S. Korea: Court Judges Past Regime's "Emergency Measure" Illegal
articles.content:
S. Korea: Court Judges Past Regime's "Emergency Measure" Illegal
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The Seoul Central District Court of south Korea on Feb. 2 confirmed the illegality of the "emergency measure" taken by the Park Chung-Hee military fascist dictatorial regime 38 years ago.
					 The court acquitted Ryu In Thae in a review, who was sentenced to death on charges of violation of the "measure" at that time.
					
					 Since the "measure" had no conditions for its enactment and it was an infringement upon the freedom of expression, any offense against it could not be incriminated, the court stated.
					
					 In April 1974 when students in Seoul launched a leaflet-scattering action as part of the struggle for democracy the military fascist dictators proclaimed the "emergency measure" No. 4, which stipulated ban on the activity of the Democratic Youths and Students League and halt to the campus movement.
					
					 The then puppet Central Intelligence Agency branded those involved as "impure anti-government forces" and cooked up the case by forcing them to make false confessions through all sorts of violence and tortures.
					
					 Even today the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in south Korea, which fully inherited the disposition of the past fascist dictatorship, are getting hell-bent on the confrontation with the DPRK by concocting spy cases and other smear plots.

articles.title: Kimjongilia Show Held in Russia
articles.content:
Kimjongilia Show Held in Russia
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- A Kimjongilia show was arranged in Nakhodka, Russia on Jan. 27 to commemorate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 On display in its venue were more than 100 potted Kimjongilias.
					
					 The mayor of Nakhodka said that Kimjongilia is a flower in praise of Kim Jong Il, a great man, carrying the world people's deep reverence for him, as well as a natural flower.
					
					 The Nakhodka citizens feel high pride at the fact that the flower of the sun has come into full bloom in their city, the mayor said, stressing that the city administration will conduct a brisk work to widely propagate Kimjongilia.
					
					 An ITAR-TASS correspondent to Maritime Territory said that Kimjongilia makes them recall the feats of Kim Jong Il who made enormous contributions to the protection of world peace and stability and the human cause of independence.
					
					 This flower has won highest appreciation at world horticultural expos and flower exhibitions, he said, adding this clearly shows how ardent the world progressives' reverence for Kim Jong Il is.
					
					 The show was visited by personages of political and social circles and citizens of Nakhodka, Pokino, Artyom and Partizansk cities.

articles.title: ITAR-TASS on Activities for Increased Production in DPRK
articles.content:
ITAR-TASS on Activities for Increased Production in DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- ITAR-TASS of Russia on Jan. 30 introduced the agitation activities for increased production brisk in the DPRK.
					 It noted that leader Kim Jong Il in his lifetime set forth the task to intensify the agitation activities.
					
					 He urged enterprises to enhance the working people's class consciousness and cultural level through dynamic mass cultural work by following the example of the People's Army, it said, adding:
					
					 He said that publicity and agitation should be conducted to suit the specific conditions without rigid formality and pattern, stressing the great influence and strong appeal of the artistic agitation in the present stirring period.
					
					 To this end art squads should go out to production sites to touch the hearts of masses, he said.
					
					 Agitation campaign is now brisk at construction sites across the country including those of the Huichon Power Station and the Mansudae area in Pyongyang, ITAR-TASS said.
					
					 Art squads are intensifying the agitation activities in various forms and methods with the main stress put on educating the people in loyalty to the party, the leader and the socialist system, it added.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Swiss Internet Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Swiss Internet Website
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on Jan. 29 posted on its Internet homepage the full text of leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Songun-based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-Victorious Banner of Our Revolution".
					 The work, published on January 29, Juche 92 (2003), clarifies the idea that the Songun revolutionary line, the Songun politics of the Workers' Party of Korea, is a powerful political mode in the present era which inherited and developed President Kim Il Sung's idea and line of giving importance to the army and a scientific revolutionary line and political mode that most correctly reflected the demands of the times and the revolution. It also expounds the validity and advantages of the Songun politics and its great vitality.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Commemorated in Africa
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Commemorated in Africa
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Events took place in Uganda, Democratic Congo and Nigeria between Jan. 25 and Feb. 3 to commemorate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il. They included seminars, reading sessions, book and photo exhibitions and film shows.
					 On display in their venues were works of Kim Jong Il and photos on his feats and books and photos introducing the Korean people in the efforts to build a thriving nation. 
					
					 The chairman of the Kampala City Committee of the Uganda National Resistance Movement said at a seminar that Kim Jong Il wisely led the DPRK to demonstrate its dignity as a politico-ideological and military power, holding high the banner of Songun.
					
					 He created international circumstances in favor of the DPRK and made great contribution to the cause of global independence through his energetic external activities, the speaker added.
					
					 The chairman of the Democratic Congolese preparatory committee for commemorating the 70th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il noted that Kim Jong Il defended the socialist cause and turned the DPRK into an invincible socialist fortress by embodying the Juche idea, the Songun idea.
					
					 The manager of a Nigerian company said that the courage and pluck of the DPRK, which remain unfazed under any adversity and attack of any formidable enemy, were fostered by Kim Jong Il, the illustrious commander of Songun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised in Pakistani Magazine
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised in Pakistani Magazine 
Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- A Pakistani magazine carried special write-ups on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					Peak Time in its February issue carried special write-ups illustrated with photos of leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un standing together.
					
					The magazine said in an article titled "Leader Kim Jong Il is immortal":
					
					The world lost the most prominent great man with the untimely passing away of Kim Jong Il, leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, on Dec. 17, 2011.
					
					He was an extraordinary thinker-theoretician.
					
					He comprehensively developed in depth the Juche idea, Songun idea created by President Kim Il Sung, founder of socialist Korea and pioneer of the human cause of independence.
					
					He was a great master of leadership.
					
					He brought the great heyday of prosperity unprecedented in the history of the Korean nation.
					
					He was the benevolent father of the people.
					
					He passed away in a field train from the great mental and physical strains while continuing his endless journey of on-site guidance for happiness of the people.
					
					The history has not known such a great person as him who devoted his all life to the people.
					
					Leader Kim Jong Il will always live in the hearts of the Korean people and the world progressives.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Commemorated in Belarus, Bulgaria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Commemorated in Belarus, Bulgaria
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Belarusian and Bulgarian preparatory committees for commemorating the 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il were formed on Jan. 29 and 31.
					 The chairman of the Permanent Committee of the Belarus-DPRK National Friend Association Named after Kim Il Sung and Alexander Paunov, first secretary of the C.C., Bulgarian Communist Party, were elected chairmen of the preparatory committees.
					
					 The preparatory committees decided to introduce the revolutionary career and feats of Kim Jong Il through media and organize meeting, seminar and other political and cultural events.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Will Always Live in Hearts: DR Congolese Personage
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Will Always Live in Hearts: DR Congolese Personage
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Otete Gaston Mboyo, chairman of the Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association, issued a statement on Jan. 25 on the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The world people are more ardently missing Kim Jong Il with the approach of February holiday, his birth anniversary, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The world has known well about the enormous feats performed by him in political, military, economic, cultural and all other fields.
					
					 It is clear that his qualification, ability and pluck were the source which led socialist Korea to a brilliant victory.
					
					 With his Songun politics he resolutely shattered the moves of the imperialist allied forces to stifle the DPRK, defended socialism of Juche and advanced the cause of Korea's reunification based on the great national unity.
					
					 He will always live in the hearts of the Korean people and the world's progressive mankind and his idea and cause will be creditably carried forward to completion by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Mexican Bulletin on Kim Jong Il's Birthplace
articles.content:
Mexican Bulletin on Kim Jong Il's Birthplace
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea released the 87th issue of its bulletin under the title "Old Home in Paektusan Secret Camp" to commemorate the 70th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The bulletin carried an article with his photo. The article said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il, leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, was born in Mt. Paektu, called a holy mountain of the Korean revolution.
					
					 His old home was a small log cabin emanating the personality of the legendary Korean guerillas. It was gun-report of the anti-Japanese war that he heard as lullaby.
					
					 Born as the son of the guerrillas, he reliably defended the sovereignty of the country and socialism from the imperialists' threat for aggression, holding high the banner of Songun.
					
					 He turned the DPRK, founded by President Kim Il Sung, into a political and ideological power which achieved the single-minded unity of the whole society unprecedented in the history of world politics and into a military power any formidable enemy dares not pounce upon.
					
					 He unfolded the grand plan for building a thriving socialist nation and wisely led the Korean people to steadily make world-startling, signal achievements in building an economic power.

articles.title: China Opposes Sanctions on Iran: Premier
articles.content:
China Opposes Sanctions on Iran: Premier
						
 Beijing, February 4 (KCNA) -- Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao at a joint press conference with German Chancellor Angela Merkel on Thursday declared China's stand against sanctions on Iran. 
					 The sanctions will not drastically solve the nuclear issue of Iran and the use of armed forces will further confuse the situation of the Middle East region and the rest of the world, the premier said. 
					
					 He said that China regards dialogue and cooperation as the only correct and effective way for solving Iran's nuclear issue. 
					
					 China will continue normal economic trade including oil trade with Iran and will not bargain on the principle, he said, stressing that the normal economic trade between countries should be protected.

articles.title: Expressway Construction in Xinjiang Uygur, China
articles.content:
Expressway Construction in Xinjiang Uygur, China
 Beijing, February 4 (KCNA) -- The Xinjiang Uygur autonomous region of China pushes forward the construction of expressway. 
					 The region has set it as a goal to extend a total length of expressway to 5,000 km by the end of 2015.

articles.title: Russia Raps West's Sanctions on Belarus
articles.content:
Russia Raps West's Sanctions on Belarus
 Moscow, February 4 (KCNA) -- Grigori Karasin, vice foreign minister of Russia, criticized the West's sanctions on Belarus in a recent press interview.
					 Russia has always warned Western countries that the policy of putting sanctions and adopting unilateral resolutions of various forms would only push the situation to a dilemma, he said, adding that sanctions on Belarus are bringing such results.
					
					 The policy of sanctions would only end in hopeless results, he said.

articles.title: Japan Utilities Log Net Loss for April-Dec. Period
articles.content:
Japan Utilities Log Net Loss for April-Dec. Period
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Four of six Japanese power utilities which released earnings results on Tuesday fell into the red for the April-December period.
					 Chubu Electric Power Co. posted a group net loss of 70.76 billion yen for the April-December period, according to its survey on Tuesday.
					
					 Hokuriku Electric Power Co. incurred a group net loss of 3.01 billion yen, while Chugoku Electric Power Co. logged a group net loss of 420 million yen.

articles.title: Hugo Chavez Frias Calls for Defending Sovereignty of Nation
articles.content:
Hugo Chavez Frias Calls for Defending Sovereignty of Nation
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez Frias called for defending the sovereignty of the nation, addressing an event on Jan. 31.
					 He underscored the need to defend the national sovereignty in reliance on the strength of the people and socialism and achieve global peace by smashing the moves of the enemies at home and abroad.

articles.title: Anti-US Demo in Kirgyzstan
articles.content:
Anti-US Demo in Kirgyzstan
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- A protest recently took place in Bishkek of Kirgyzstan in demand of the removal of the U.S. air-force base.
					 The protesters rushed to the U.S. embassy in their country, putting up such placards as reading "Yankees, go home!" and made a strong protest with it against U.S. warplanes' jettison of spent fuel causing huge damage to the farmland around the base.
					
					 Demanding the prompt removal of this military base from the country, they warned that they would block the road to the base unless their demand is met.

articles.title: Vietnam Reports 2nd Bird Flu Death in a a Month
articles.content:
Vietnam Reports 2nd Bird Flu Death in a Month
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- A Vietnamese official on Thursday confirmed the country's second human death from bird flu in less than a month.
					 Test results confirm that a 26-year-old woman died of the disease on Jan. 28, said Truong Hoai Phong, director of the provincial health department.

articles.title: Cooperation among Asian Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Asian Countries
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Afghanistan and Pakistan on Wednesday made public a joint communique on an enhanced engagement for promoting bilateral cooperation in various fields.
					 On the same day Cambodia and India signed a Memorandum of Understanding, aiming at helping Cambodia to establish information technology development centers in Phnom Penh municipality, Siem Reap and Preah Sihanouk provinces.

articles.title: German Unemployment Reaches 2.285 Million
articles.content:
German Unemployment Reaches 2.285 Million
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- German unemployment reached 2.285 million in January, according to an official data by the German economy ministry on Tuesday.

articles.title: Damage by Severe Cold and Heavy Snowfall Grows in Europe
articles.content:
Damage by Severe Cold and Heavy Snowfall Grows in Europe
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Damage by severe cold and tremendous snowfall is increasing in Europe.
					 Bad weather lasting from Jan. 27 left 210 persons dead in Europe.
					
					 In particular, more than 100 people died in Ukraine and over 20 in Romania.
					
					 At least nine people were frozen to death in the southwestern region of Poland on Friday.
					
					 In Bulgaria 10 people died of the most biting cold in one hundred years, 7 in Serbia, 5 in the Czech Republic and 2 each in Austria, Slovakia and Greece.
					
					 The most severe cold and heavy snowfall in 27 years hit Italy, paralyzing railway, air and land traffics whereby thousands of people were left in a fix without help and bringing football matches to a halt.

articles.title: Portavoz de UPC apoya justa lucha de hombres de prensa de Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Portavoz de UPC apoya justa lucha de hombres de prensa de Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 5 de febrero (ACNC) -- Hace poco, el sindicato de radiodifusion MBC del Sur de Corea comenzo la huelga general indefinida en protesta al intento de  apoderarla de la banda de Lee Myung Bak.
					El portavoz del Comite Central de la Union de Periodistas de Corea en su declaracion del dia 4 senala que la huelga es la explosion de la colera y protesta de los hombres de prensa y los habitantes surcoreanos a la banda traidora que utiliza la prensa al servilismo a grandes potencias, la dominacion fascista y las maniobras anti-reunificacion y fratricidas. 
					
					Al tomar el poder, la banda de Lee Myung Bak empeoro las leyes relacionadas con la prensa, infiltro a los elementos conservadores y ultraderechistas en el circulo mediatico con el objetivo de exterminar la opinion publica aspirante a la independencia, la democracia y la reunificacion y reprimio despiadadamente a los hombres de prensa en contra de la prensa progubernamental, revela la nota y prosigue: 
					
					Ahora, la banda traidora que esta a punto de derrumbarse perdiendo totalmente el respaldo de los habitantes, se desespera para evadir el severo juicio y realizar la ambicion de retomar el poder en las elecciones de este ano inventando a su favor la opinion publica y desinformaciones adhiriendose a todos medios venales de prensa.
					
					Es natural que los hombres conscientes de prensa del Sur de Corea se levanten en la lucha contra las maquinaciones de la banda traidora encaminada a la realizacion venal de los medios de prensa y su conversion en reaccionarios lamentandose de la tragica realidad de los medios de prensa convertidos en viles servidores de la banda de los conservadores titeres.
					
					Los medios de prensa de la epoca de la reunificacion independiente deben castigar severamente a la banda traidora que actua freneticamente con el servilismo a EE.UU. y la confrontacion fratricida y ser trompeteros que impulsan activamente la gran marcha por la reunificacion independiente de los connacionales que avanzan bajo la bandera del ideal "Entre nosotros, los connacionales".
					
					Todos los periodistas y hombres de la palabra de la RPDC estan convencidos de que saldra victoriosa brillante la justa lucha de los hombres mediaticos surcoreanos por traer el nuevo mundo independizado y democratizado y seguir la corriente de la epoca del 15 de Junio por la reunificacion.
